metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:filehash_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:filehash_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the filehash_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value.
Test that a filehash_object with a path pattern match is supported.
Test that a filehash_object with a path and filename pattern match is supported.
Test that a filehash_object with a path and filename not equals is supported.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for limited depth of recursion.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported in the 'up' direction.

filehash_test.comment: Test that the filehash_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value.
Test that a filehash_object with a path pattern match is supported.
Test that a filehash_object with a path and filename pattern match is supported.
Test that a filehash_object with a path and filename not equals is supported.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for limited depth of recursion.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported in the 'up' direction.

filehash_object.comment: This object represents a filehash_object with a path equal to 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer' and a filename equal to 'iexplore.exe'.
This object represents a filehash_object with a path that matches the regular expression '^C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer.*' and a filename equal to 'iexplore.exe'.
This object represents a filehash_object with a path equal to 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer' and a filename that matches the regular expression '^i.*'.
This object represents a filehash_object with path equal to 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer', and a filename that is not equal to 'iexplore.exe'.
This object represents a filehash_object with path starting at 'C:\Program Files', recursing down 1 level, and filename equals 'iexplore.exe'.
This object represents a filehash_object with path starting at 'C:\Program Files', recursing down infinitely, and filename equals 'install.ins'.
This object represents a filehash_object with path starting at 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\SIGNUP', recursing up 1 level, and filename equals 'iexplore.exe'.

filehash_state.comment: This filehash_state represents a filehash_object which has a path equal to 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer', a filename equal to 'iexplore.exe', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This filehash_state represents a filehash_object which has a path that matches the regular expression '^C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer\\.*', a filename that matches the regular expression '^i.*', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This filehash_state represents a filehash_object which has a path equal to 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer', a filename that matches the regular expression '^i.*', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This filehash_state represents a filehash_object which has a path of 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer', a filename that is not equal to 'iexplore.exe', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This filehash_state represents a filehash_object which has a path that equals 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer', a filename that equals 'iexplore.exe', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This filehash_state represents a filehash_object which has a path that matches the regular expression '^C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer.*', a filename that equals 'install.ins', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.
